mini_game
Class MiniGame

java.lang.Object
  mini_game.MiniGame

public abstract class MiniGame
extends java.lang.Object

The classes from the mini_game package, including this class, provide a framework for making a Swing based game. This class serves as the focal point of that game, with access to all the important game data and controls. Note that we will use a Timer to provide fixed-rate updates of the game data and rendering, so we will also use a ReentrantLock to make sure we don't change data mid-render.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Richard McKenna

Constructor Detail

MiniGame

public MiniGame(java.lang.String appTitle,
                int initFramesPerSecond)
This constructor sets up everything, including the GUI and the game data, and starts the timer, which will force state updates and rendering. Note that rendering will not be seen until the game's window is set visible.

Parameters:
appTitle - the name of the game application, it will be put in the window's title bar.
initFramesPerSecond - the frame rate to be used for running the game application. This refers to how many times each second the game state is updated and rendered.
Method Detail

getDataModel

public MiniGameDataModel getDataModel()
For accessing the game data.

Returns:
the GameDataModel that stores all the game data.

getFrameRate

public int getFrameRate()
For accessing the frame rate.

Returns:
the frame rate, in frames per second of this application.

getGUIButtons

public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,Sprite> getGUIButtons()
For accessing the game GUI buttons.

Returns:
the data structure containing all the game buttons.

getGUIDecor

public java.util.TreeMap<java.lang.String,Sprite> getGUIDecor()
For accessing the game GUI decor.

Returns:
the data structure containing all the game decor.

getBoundaryLeft

public float getBoundaryLeft()
For accessing the distance from the left edge of the game canvas that will be part of the playing game area.

Returns:
the left boundary in pixels of the playing game area.

public float getBoundaryRight()
For accessing the distance from the left edge of the game canvas that represents the right edge of the playing game area.

Returns:
the right boundary in pixels of the playing game area.

For accessing the distance from the top edge of the game canvas that will be part of the playing game area.

Returns:
the top boundary in pixels of the playing game area.

getBoundaryBottom

public float getBoundaryBottom()
For accessing the distance from the top edge of the game canvas that represents the bottom edge of the playing game area.

Returns:
the bottom boundary in pixels of the playing game area.

getCanvas

public javax.swing.JPanel getCanvas()
For accessing the canvas, which is the JPanel that serves as the game rendering surface and mouse event source.

initTimer

public void initTimer()
Sets up the timer, which will run the game updates and rendering on a fixed-interval schedule.

beginUsingData

public void beginUsingData()
This method locks access to the game data for the thread that invokes this method. All other threads will be locked out upon their own call to this method and will be forced to wait until this thread ends its use.

endUsingData

public void endUsingData()
This method frees access to the game data for the thread that invokes this method. This will result in notifying any waiting thread that it may proceed.

killApplication

public void killApplication()
Call this method to kill the application associated with this object, including closing the window.

loadImage

public java.awt.Image loadImage(java.lang.String fileName)
Loads an image using the fileName as the full path, returning the constructed and completely loaded Image.

Parameters:
fileName - full path and name of the location of the image file to be loaded.
Returns:
the loaded Image, with all data fully loaded.

loadImageWithColorKey

public java.awt.Image loadImageWithColorKey(java.lang.String fileName,
                                            java.awt.Color colorKey)
Loads an image using the fileName as the full path, returning the constructed and completely loaded Image. Note that all pixels with the colorKey value will be made transparent by setting their alpha values to 0.

Parameters:
fileName - full path and name of the location of the image file to be loaded.
Returns:
the loaded Image, with all data fully loaded and with colorKey pixels transparent.

processButtonPress

public boolean processButtonPress(int x,
                                  int y)
When invoked, this method results in each button in the GUI testing to see if the x, y coordinates are inside its bounds. If they are, the button's actionPerformed method is invoked and the appropriate event response is executed.

Parameters:
x - the x coordinate on the canvas of the mouse press
y - the y coordinate on the canvas of the mouse press
Returns:
true if the mouse press resulted in a button's event handler being executed, false otherwise. This is important because if false is returned, other game logic should proceed.

startGame

public void startGame()
Displays the window, allowing the MiniGame application to start accepting user input and allow the user to actually play the game.

update

public void update()
This method is called once per frame and updates and renders everything in the game including the gui.

initData

public abstract void initData()
Initializes the game data used by the application. Note that it is this method's obligation to construct and set this Game's custom GameDataModel object as well as any other needed game objects.

initGUIControls

public abstract void initGUIControls()
Initializes the game controls, like buttons, used by the game application.

initGUIHandlers

public abstract void initGUIHandlers()
Initializes the game event handlers for things like game gui buttons.

reset

public abstract void reset()
Invoked when a new game is started, it resets all relevant game data and gui control states.

updateGUI

public abstract void updateGUI()
Updates the state of all gui controls according to the current game conditions.
